at.nineyards.anyline.camera

Class FocusConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.nineyards.anyline.camera.FocusConfig

  • public class FocusConfig
extends Object

    A class for configuring the focus settings. Should be used together with CameraView

    Use the FocusConfig.Builder to create a config.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FocusConfig.Builder
      A builder to create a FocusConfig

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NO_AUTO_FOCUS_TIMER 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void callAutoFocus()
      Call auto focus manually.
      void init(Camera camera)
      Init this config on a given camera.
      boolean isFocusModeAuto() 
      void resetAutoFocusTimer()
      Resets the autofocus timer (next autofocus will be autoFocusInterval away after now).
      Use this all the time when you think your current focus is good (if there is no need to call auto focus currently.
      void stopAutoFocusTimer()
      Stop the thread that is responsible for calling autofocus every autoFocusInterval.
      Note: This HAS TO BE CALLED if not used with AnylineCameraView

      • NO_AUTO_FOCUS_TIMER

        public static final int NO_AUTO_FOCUS_TIMER
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(Camera camera)

        Init this config on a given camera.

        Note: No need to call this if used with AnylineCameraView

        Note2: stopAutoFocusTimer() has to be called if this is used and you're done with it.

        Parameters:
        camera - - the camera to use this config with

      • stopAutoFocusTimer

        public void stopAutoFocusTimer()
        Stop the thread that is responsible for calling autofocus every autoFocusInterval.
        Note: This HAS TO BE CALLED if not used with AnylineCameraView

      • resetAutoFocusTimer

        public void resetAutoFocusTimer()
        Resets the autofocus timer (next autofocus will be autoFocusInterval away after now).
        Use this all the time when you think your current focus is good (if there is no need to call auto focus currently. E.g. when you just received a valid value.)

      • callAutoFocus

        public void callAutoFocus()
        Call auto focus manually.
        This should be called if no auto focus interval has been specified in the focus config, otherwise devices with best focus mode "auto", will not focus!

        Note: this does nothing on devices where the best focus mode is a none auto mode (like continues picture)

      • isFocusModeAuto

        public boolean isFocusModeAuto()
        Returns:
        true if the current focus mode is a mode that requires a autofocus call (no need to check this before using callAutoFocus, because this is checked internally)
